rComments: It has been a few years since I took her class on Paul and recently thought about it again.  Now that I've graduated I look back and see that this class was one of the best.  Solid lectures, a prof who actually cared and learned the names of many in the class and very knowledgeable.  Wishing now that there had been more like her.
Amazing- helpful (!) and interesting.  Loved the class.

What a terrific experience- I am not Jewish so was wary when I signed up for this course but Prof. Urowitz made the material 'real' and she had a great sense of humor.  She is very giving of her time when you approach her and seems to really enjoy teaching (not always the case in university courses).
Nice prof one of my favs... Marks hard tho but I blv no exam just an in class essay at the end of the term

The program has had inconsistent professors for four years, so upon taking this course I was hoping for the best. Professor Urowitz tries hard to make the connections, but sometimes it feels like the side-notes go deeper than the actual lectures. The material moved fairly quick and the time frame of the Jewish history felt rushed

For an intro course she treats the class like they were already taught Judaism. I took the course to learn about Judaism as I was not raised Jewish and did not learn it through school. She should teach the class like they don't already have a strong knowledge base on the religion. This is an INTRO course! Plus she talks wayyy too fast.

Professor Urowitz is very knowledgeable and thoroughly enjoys her job which reflects in her teaching style and makes you interested. The course material was a little dry but she is very approachable and will provide a through explanation upon request.  I didn't particularly enjoy the lectures but she is a great prof!
